treble_crochet cluster *yo 3 times insert hook in st/space yo pull up lp yo draw through 2 loops 3 times repeat from * twice more in same st/space 4 loops on hook yo draw through all loops 4trtr-cluster 4 treble treble_crochet cluster *yo 4 times insert hook in st/space yo pull up lp yo draw through 2 loops 4 times repeat from * 3 more times in same st/space 5 loops on hook yo draw through all loops puff puff yo insert hook in st/space yo pull up loop 3 times in same st/space 7 loops on hook yo draw through all loops pattern notes double magic_ring i prefer to start all my snowflakes with a double magic_ring this is executed just like a normal magic_ring with the exception of wrapping the yarn twice at the beginning instead of once if you prefer you may use a standard magic_ring i do not recommend replacing the magic_ring with chains as the snowflakes have been designed to have a very tightly closed center and the chains will leave a visible hole stiffening snowflakes these snowflakes have been designed to be firmly stiffened and most will not hang properly without stiffening i have provided instructions at the end of these patterns for how i prefer to stiffen items 3 | page copyright © 2022 by jessica wifall all rights reserved instructions night diamond approximately 3inches make a double magic_ring round 1 ch1 does not count as st in magic_ring 1sc * ch10 1sc repeat from * 4 more times ch4 1dtr in first single_crochet counts as last 10- chain pull magic_ring tight 6 single_crochet 6 10-chain round 2 1sc around dtr * ch10 1sc in next chain-space ch2 1sc in same chain-space repeat from * 4 more times ch10 1sc in next chain-space 1sc in first single_crochet counts as last 2-chain 12 single_crochet 6 10-chain 6 2-chain round 3 1sc around single_crochet * skip 1 single_crochet 5ss ch6 slip_stitch in fifth chain from hook 1ss picot made 5ss skip 1 single_crochet 1sc in chain-2 space ch6 slip_stitch in fifth chain from hook 1ss
